page.title: 10Chatteris - Fen Population
page.content: The Fens have always been sparsely populated, with families living in isolated cottages in the middle of the fields. Even if they had a horse and cart, when it rained the tracks were muddy so they had to walk because the horse and cart would get stuck in the mud. It was a hard life and, not surprisingly, the people wanted to live in modern and better built houses. Gradually they have moved into towns and the old cottages are being demolished. Only the larger houses belonging to the farmers are left. Not many men are needed to work on the land now because of the use of very efficient machines. Stockmen no longer need to be on hand to look after the horses. With modern transport any farmworkers who are needed can travel to work more easily.
